name: 0leop

body.origin:
|- wbr(ch0o, cleo, ch0o)
-| wcel(ch0o, cho)
-| wi(wcel(ch0o, cho), wbr(ch0o, cleo, ch0o))

cumulated.origin:
|- wbr(ch0o, cleo, ch0o)
-| wcel(ch0o, cho)
-| wi(wcel(ch0o, cho), wbr(ch0o, cleo, ch0o))

|- wbr(ch0o, cleo, ch0o)
-| wi(wcel(ch0o, cho), wbr(ch0o, cleo, ch0o))

comment: The zero operator is a positive operator. (The literature calls it "positive", even though in some sense it is really "nonnegative".) Part of Example 12.2(i) in [Young] p. 142. (Contributed by NM, 23-Jul-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
